metadata.name: “Supersticiones del Caribe” - KNG
metadata.description:
This piece is a reference to all the strong superstitions that are enveloped within the Caribbean culture. In every corner lurks a different lore, each to be fearful of. 

-Broken Mirror / 7 years of bad luck
-Carnival Mask / A demon that takes on many forms
-Black Cat / If one crosses your path it is an omen of troubled times ahead
-Galipote / Werewolf creatures that warns of death
-Rain and Sunshine / A witch is getting married
-Crowing Rooster / If you cross your eyes when it crows, you will be permanently stuck that way
-Broom / Upside down broom is a quick way to cast a spell to help rid yourself of overstayed guests
-Ciguapa / A female entity that lures men to their death or is an omen of death

The child protects herself with a cross, a lady of our sorrows necklace, an evil eye bracelet, a salt ring, black candles, and palo santo. 

The piece comes with the original draft sketches and a full sized 12in x 10in giclée print.
